title: 👋 Hi,
text: I am a Junior Full-Stack Developer with a strong QA / testing mindset and a background in Mathematics and Education. Before transitioning into software development, I worked as a mathematics teacher. This experience shaped the way I approach problems today: structured thinking, logical reasoning, and a strong focus on clarity and correctness.

sections.title: 🧠 From Mathematics to Software Development
items: Break complex problems into smaller parts,
And validate results instead of assuming they are correct.
sections.additional: These skills naturally transferred to software development.
sections.quote: When I write code, I don't only ask 'Does it work?' — I also ask 'Is it reliable, testable, and understandable?'

sections.title: 🧪 Quality & Testing First
sections.description: Testing is an integral part of how I work, not an afterthought.
items: Think in scenarios and edge cases,
Validate error handling and data consistency,
Apply basic performance and load testing when relevant.
sections.additional: This quality-first approach allows me to build software that teams can trust and evolve safely.

sections.title: 📘 Education & Knowledge Sharing
sections.description: With my background as an educator, I naturally focus on:
sections.additional: I enjoy explaining technical concepts in a simple way — whether through documentation, project case studies, or internal explanations — because good software is not only written, but also understood.

sections.title: 🎯 What I'm Looking For
sections.description: I am looking for a junior full-stack position where I can:
items: And work in a team that values code quality, learning, and collaboration.
sections.additional: I am particularly motivated by environments where development, testing, and clear communication go hand in hand.

beyond.title: 🚀 Beyond Code
beyond.description: Outside of development, my mathematical and teaching background continues to influence how I learn, explain, and collaborate. I believe strong software is built by people who care about logic, clarity, and reliability — values I bring into every project.
